bioghist.p: Harry Kline (d. 1964) studied chemical engineering at the Case Institute of Technology. In the mid 1920s, Kline was awarded a fellowship at the Mellon Institute, where he developed an interest in phenolic resins. From the late 1920s to 1943, he worked for the Bakelite Company in Bound Brook, New Jersey. In 1943, he became the Director of Phenolic Plastics with Reichhold Chemicals, Inc. From 1950 until his death, Kline served Reichhold Chemicals as the Vice President in charge of the Phenolic Plastics Division.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of lectures, research reports, laboratory notes, correspondence, and graphs. Most of the materials were generated while Kline was working for the Bakelite Corporation, though there is also a notebook of laboratory notes from Kline's fellowship at the Mellon Institute. The majority of the items concern phenolic resins, varnishes, and plastics.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
